fr.upmc.admissionController

Class AdmissionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.upmc.admissionController.AdmissionController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdmissionControllerCoordinationI, AdmissionControllerManagementI, AdmissionControllerServicesI, fr.upmc.components.ComponentI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.ComponentImplementedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI, ComputerStateDataConsumerI, java.rmi.Remote

    public class AdmissionController
extends fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
implements AdmissionControllerServicesI, AdmissionControllerManagementI, AdmissionControllerCoordinationI, ComputerStateDataConsumerI
    The class AdmissionController implements a component that manage applications admissions for the data center and allocate necessary resources.

    Description

    The Admission Controller (AC) component simulates the execution of a data center by receiving requests from an external application to execute her on the data center. If resources are free the Admission Controller creates all necessary components (RD, AVM, ...) and allocates resources (computer's cores) for this application. As a component, the Admission Controller offers a request submission service through the interface AdmissionControllerServicesI implemented by AdmissionControllerServicesInboundPort inbound port. the Admission Controller can receive state of computers through the implementation of the interface ComputerStateDataConsumerI. 
     invariant      true

    Created on : 18 novembre 2017

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Morvan Lassauzay
